name: Presidio of San Francisco
description: Presidio of San Francisco, a former military post turned national park, offers trails, historic architecture, art installations, and stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge and bay.
fullDescription: Presidio of San Francisco, a former military post turned national park, offers trails, historic architecture, art installations, and stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge and bay.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free or low-cost access to trails, beaches, and historic sites
- Ranger-led walks, talks, and educational programs
- Visitor centers with exhibits and park information
- Junior Ranger programs for children
howToGetIt:
Most National Park Service sites in the Bay Area offer free admission. Some sites have entrance fees:
- Standard entrance fee: $15-$35 per vehicle (where applicable)
- Alcatraz ferry tickets sold separately

**Save with park passes:**
- **America the Beautiful Pass**: $80/year for unlimited access to 2,000+ federal recreation areas
- **Every Kid Outdoors Pass**: Free for 4th graders and their families
- **Access Pass**: Free lifetime pass for visitors with permanent disabilities
- **Senior Pass**: $80 lifetime or $20/year for ages 62+
address: Presidio of San Francisco, San Francisco, CA, 94129
keywords: Presidio, San Francisco, National Park Service, free admission, trails, Golden Gate Bridge, history, art, Crissy Field
